raamah_2380.name: Raamah
raamah_2380.bio: One of the sons of Cush ([Gen. 10:7](/gen#Gen.10.7)).

rabsaris_2382.name: Rabsaris
rabsaris_2382.bio: Chief of the Heads, one of the three officers whom Sennacherib sent from Lachish with a threatening message to Jerusalem ([2 Kings 18:17](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.17); [Jer. 39:3](/jer#Jer.39.3), [13](/jer#Jer.39.13)).

rabshakeh_2384.name: Rabshakeh
rabshakeh_2384.bio: Chief of the princes, the name given to the chief cup-bearer or the vizier of the Assyrian court; one of Sennacherib’s messengers to Hezekiah. See the speech he delivered, in the Hebrew language, in the hearing of all the people, as he stood near the wall on the north side of the city ([2 Kings 18:17-37](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.17)). He and the other envoys returned to their master and reported that Hezekiah and his people were obdurate, and would not submit.

rachab_2385.name: Rachab
rachab_2385.bio: '=Rahab, a name found in the genealogy of our Lord ([Matt. 1:5](/matt#Matt.1.5)).

rachel_2386.name: Rachel
rachel_2386.bio: Ewe, “the daughter”, “the somewhat petulant, peevish, and self-willed though beautiful younger daughter” of Laban, and one of Jacob’s wives ([Gen. 29:6](/gen#Gen.29.6), [28](/gen#Gen.29.28)). He served Laban fourteen years for her, so deep was Jacob’s affection for her.

rahab_2388.name: Rahab
rahab_2388.bio: Insolence; pride, a poetical name applied to Egypt in [Ps. 87:4](/ps#Ps.87.4); [89:10](/ps#Ps.89.10); [Isa. 51:9](/isa#Isa.51.9), as “the proud one.” Rahab, (Heb.

raham_2389.name: Raham
raham_2389.bio: Merciful, one of the descendants of Caleb, the son of Hezron ([1 Chr. 2:44](/1chr#1Chr.2.44)).

ram_2391.name: Ram ((Hebrew: אֲרָם Aram)
ram_2391.bio: The son of Hezron, and one of the ancestors of the royal line ([Ruth 4:19](/ruth#Ruth.4.19)). The margin of [1 Chr. 2:9](/1chr#1Chr.2.9), also [Matt.

ram_2392.name: Ram (Elevated)
ram_2392.bio: One of the sons of Jerahmeel ([1 Chr. 2:25](/1chr#1Chr.2.25), [27](/1chr#1Chr.2.27)).

ram_2393.name: Ram (son of Hezron)
ram_2393.bio: A person mentioned in [Job 32:2](/job#Job.32.2) as founder of a clan to which Elihu belonged. The same as Aram of [Gen. 22:21](/gen#Gen.22.21).

rapha_2447.name: Rapha
rapha_2447.bio: A Benjamite, the son of Binea ([1 Chr. 8:2](/1chr#1Chr.8.2), [37](/1chr#1Chr.8.37)), a descendant of Saul.

raphu_2397.name: Raphu
raphu_2397.bio: Healed, a Benjamite, whose son Palti was one of the twelve spies ([Num. 13:9](/num#Num.13.9)).

reba_2400.name: Reba
reba_2400.bio: Fourth, one of the Midianite chiefs slain by the Israelites in the wilderness ([Num. 31:8](/num#Num.31.8); [Josh. 13:21](/josh#Josh.13.21)).

rebekah_2401.name: Rebekah
rebekah_2401.bio: A noose, the daughter of Bethuel, and the wife of Isaac ([Gen. 22:23](/gen#Gen.22.23); [24:67](/gen#Gen.24.67)). The circumstances under which Abraham’s “steward” found her at the “city of Nahor,” in Padan-aram, are narrated in [Gen.

rechab_2402.name: Rechab (father of Jehonadab)
rechab_2402.bio: One of Ishbosheth’s “captains of bands” or leaders of predatory troops ([2 Sam. 4:2](/2sam#2Sam.4.2)).

rechab_2403.name: Rechab (Captain of a Band)
rechab_2403.bio: The father of Jehonadab, who was the father of the Rechabites ([2 Kings 10:15](/2kgs#2Kgs.10.15), [23](/2kgs#2Kgs.10.23); [Jer. 35:6-19](/jer#Jer.35.6)).

reelaiah_2406.name: Reelaiah
reelaiah_2406.bio: Thunder of the Lord, one of the princes who returned from the Exile ([Neh. 7:7](/neh#Neh.7.7)); called also Reelaiah ([Ezra 2:2](/ezra#Ezra.2.2)).

regem-melech_2408.name: Regem-melech
regem-melech_2408.bio: Friend of the king, one of the two messengers sent by the exiled Jews to Jerusalem in the time of Darius ([Zech. 7:2](/zech#Zech.7.2)) to make inquiries at the temple.

rehabiah_2409.name: Rehabiah
rehabiah_2409.bio: Enlargement of the Lord, the son of Eliezer, and grandson of Moses ([1 Chr. 23:17](/1chr#1Chr.23.17); [24:21](/1chr#1Chr.24.21)).

rehob_2410.name: Rehob (2 Samuel 8:3 2 Samuel 8:12)
rehob_2410.bio: The father of Hadadezer, king of Tobah ([2 Sam. 8:3](/2sam#2Sam.8.3), [12](/2sam#2Sam.8.12)).

rehoboam_2412.name: Rehoboam
rehoboam_2412.bio: He enlarges the people, the successor of Solomon on the throne, and apparently his only son. He was the son of Naamah “the Ammonitess,” some well-known Ammonitish princess ([1 Kings 14:21](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.21); [2 Chr. 12:13](/2chr#2Chr.12.13)).

rehum_2413.name: Rehum (leader of clan of Israel)
rehum_2413.bio: One of “the children of the province” who returned from the Captivity ([Ezra 2:2](/ezra#Ezra.2.2)); the same as “Nehum” ([Neh. 7:7](/neh#Neh.7.7)).

rehum_2414.name: Rehum (Persian commanding officer)
rehum_2414.bio: The “chancellor” of Artaxerxes, who sought to stir him up against the Jews ([Ezra 4:8-24](/ezra#Ezra.4.8)) and prevent the rebuilding of the walls and the temple of Jerusalem.

rei_2417.name: Rei
rei_2417.bio: Friendly, one who maintained true allegiance to king David ([1 Kings 1:8](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.8)) when Adonijah rebelled.

rekem_2418.name: Rekem (one of the towns of Benjamin)
rekem_2418.bio: One of the five Midianite kings whom the Israelites destroyed ([Num. 31:8](/num#Num.31.8)).

rekem_2419.name: Rekem (One of the sons of Hebron)
rekem_2419.bio: One of the sons of Hebron ([1 Chr. 2:43](/1chr#1Chr.2.43), [44](/1chr#1Chr.2.44)).

remaliah_2420.name: Remaliah
remaliah_2420.bio: Adorned by the Lord, the father of Pekah, who conspired successfully against Pekahiah ([2 Kings 15:25](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.25), [27](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.27), [30](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.30), [32](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.32), [37](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.37); [Isa. 7:1](/isa#Isa.7.1), [4](/isa#Isa.7.4), [5](/isa#Isa.7.5), [9](/isa#Isa.7.9); 8:6).

rephael_2421.name: Rephael
rephael_2421.bio: Healed of God, one of Shemaiah’s sons. He and his brethren, on account of their “strength for service,” formed one of the divisions of the temple porters ([1 Chr. 26:7](/1chr#1Chr.26.7), [8](/1chr#1Chr.26.8)).

rephaiah_2426.name: Rephaiah (ruler of a half-district of Jerusalem)

reuben_2429.name: Reuben
reuben_2429.bio: Behold a son!, the eldest son of Jacob and Leah ([Gen. 29:32](/gen#Gen.29.32)). His sinful conduct, referred to in [Gen.

reuel_2430.name: Reuel (son of Esau and Bashemath)
reuel_2430.bio: A son of Esau and Bashemath ([Gen. 36:4](/gen#Gen.36.4), [10](/gen#Gen.36.10); [1 Chr. 1:35](/1chr#1Chr.1.35)).

reuel_2432.name: Reuel (Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi)

rezin_2435.name: Rezin (king of Aram)
rezin_2435.bio: Firm; a prince, a king of Syria, who joined Pekah (q.v.) in an invasion of the kingdom of Judah ([2 Kings 15:37](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.37); [16:5-9](/2kgs#2Kgs.16.5); [Isa. 7:1-8](/isa#Isa.7.1)). Ahaz induced Tiglath-pileser III.

rezon_2437.name: Rezon
rezon_2437.bio: Prince, son of Eliadah. Abandoning the service of Hadadezer, the king of Zobah, on the occasion of his being defeated by David, he became the “captain over a band” of marauders, and took Damascus, and became king of Syria ([1 Kings 11:23-25](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.23); [2 Sam. 8:3-8](/2sam#2Sam.8.3)).

rhesa_2438.name: Rhesa
rhesa_2438.bio: Affection, son of Zorobabel, mentioned in the genealogy of our Lord ([Luke 3:27](/luke#Luke.3.27)).

rhoda_2439.name: Rhoda
rhoda_2439.bio: a rose, the damsel in the house of Mary, the mother of John Mark. She came to hearken when Peter knocked at the door of the gate ( Acts 12:12-15 ).

rimmon_2441.name: Rimmon
rimmon_2441.bio: A man of Beeroth ([2 Sam. 4:2](/2sam#2Sam.4.2)), one of the four Gibeonite cities. (See [Josh.

riphath_2443.name: Riphath
riphath_2443.bio: A crusher, Gomer’s second son ([Gen. 10:3](/gen#Gen.10.3)), supposed to have been the ancestor of the Paphlagonians.

rizpah_2444.name: Rizpah
rizpah_2444.bio: Coal; hot stone, the daughter of Aiah, and one of Saul’s concubines. She was the mother of Armoni and Mephibosheth ([2 Sam. 3:7](/2sam#2Sam.3.7); [21:8](/2sam#2Sam.21.8), [10](/2sam#2Sam.21.10), [11](/2sam#2Sam.21.11)).

romamti-ezer_2446.name: Romamti-ezer
romamti-ezer_2446.bio: Elevation of help, one of the sons of Heman, “the king’s seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn.” He was head of the “four-and-twentieth” course of singers ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [31](/1chr#1Chr.25.31)).

rufus_2449.name: Rufus (who was chosen in the Lord)

ruth_2450.name: Ruth
ruth_2450.bio: A friend, a Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, whose father, Elimelech, had settled in the land of Moab. On the death of Elimelech and Mahlon, Naomi came with Ruth, her daughter-in-law, who refused to leave her, to Bethlehem, the old home from which Elimelech had migrated. There she had a rich relative, Boaz, to whom Ruth was eventually married.
